byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and RICK LYMAN
byline.contributor: Alison Smale and Joanna Berendt contributed reporting.

abstract: Pres Obama speaks in Warsaw at his last NATO summit meeting, reassuring European leaders concerned over Britain's decision to leave European Union and other threats to trans-Atlantic pact; conference participants discuss other challenges and took measures to reaffirm their commitment to agreement.
snippet: The president assured alliance partners that threats from terrorism and an aggressive Russia would not deter the United States....

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis

lead_paragraph: The president assured alliance partners that threats from terrorism and an aggressive Russia would not deter the United States.

headline.main: Obama Tells NATO That ‘Europe Can Count On’ the U.S.
headline.print_headline: Obama Tells NATO That ‘Europe Can Count On’ the U.S.
